result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/28/22 - attempted, not known

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:09 PM Defendant James David Mason appeared by video, in custody in Waupaca.  Attorney William George Weiland appeared by video for James David Mason. Prosecuting attorney Cass W Cousins in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court confirms that the defendant can hear and see using the video Zoom.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:42 PM Defendant James David Mason appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel
Court questions if he has applied to the public defender.
Defendant states he is eligible but not been appointed counsel yet.
Court questions the defendant if adjourning the Initial Appearance is acceptable.
Defendant states he is being held on a PO hold.
Defendant questions his charges.
Court informs him of charges. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court adjourns

Absolutely no contact with the S.F.R., her residence or place of employment or any family members
No contact with M.F.M.

1:51 PM Defendant James D Mason appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping and Misdemeanor Battery (with possible upgrade to substantial battery).
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
State has complied with victim rights notification.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule objects to the cash bond and states her objections on the record.
Defendant is currently on a PO hold.
Court will set a $1,500 cash bond with conditions as stated.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
